result.execSummary:
The defendant Larry B. Gascoigne was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Larry B. Gascoigne is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Larry B. Gascoigne was found guilty of Burglary-Armed w/ Dangerous Weapon [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to the time he is already serving.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with Ronald W, Jonathan E, Aihalon S, Mariah E, Jesse H, Lauren C or their residences, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

Total Extended Supervision                       5 years     0 months
with conditions consecutive to the time he is already serving.

Defendant Larry B. Gascoigne appeared with Attorney Laura Ann Walker.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Michael David Graveley appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  ST called witness KPD Det. Josh Zeller ; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty  Walker.   ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Final pre-trial scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 08:50 am.
